meanings.definition: Exhibiting different properties in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The anisotropic material conducted heat differently depending on the direction.
meanings.sent2: The anisotropic crystal refracted light in various ways.
meanings.sent3: The anisotropic fabric seemed to change color when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as anisotropic as the weather, shifting unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The anisotropic nature of the maze made it challenging to navigate.

meanings.definition: Not isotropic; having properties that differ in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The anisotropic substance displayed varying strengths in different orientations.
meanings.sent2: The anisotropic metal showed different levels of conductivity along its axes.
meanings.sent3: The anisotropic puzzle toy kept changing its shape unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were as anisotropic as a kaleidoscope, constantly shifting.
meanings.sent5: The anisotropic pattern on the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing.
